result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob W Lange was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program;
Sentence credit of 70 days to be applied if imposed;
Court will allow for early termination of probation after 3 years if restitution is PAID IN FULL and upon approval of Agent.

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob W Lange

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob W Lange in court with attorney John Joseph Grau. Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. A representative from Kettle Moraine School District makes statements. The State makes recommendations. Attorney Grau makes statements. The defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

4 Years Imprisonment. (Credit - 70 days). STAYED. 
	2 Years of Initial Confinement
	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Term of Probation: 5 Years (The Court will allow for early termination of probation after 3 years if restitution is paid in ful and the approval of the agent)
Conditions of Probation:

No contact with Kettle Moraine School District;

No Contact with Kalvin  W.;

No Contact with the Co-Actors;
	
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;

Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;

No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctors prescription

Inform agent of all prescriptions;

Defendant to obtain GED; 

Restitution: $6123.00 to be paid to Kettle Moraine School District as a condition of probation
Restitution: $1000.00 to be paid to Deborah P. as a condition of probation
Restitution: $1770.00 to be paid to Liberty Mutual Insurance as a condition of probation

COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DRGOD: $10.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
	
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on July 26, 2019 at 10:30 am.
Filed by the State. In Re: Request for adjournment of 5/28/19 appearance.  **Approved by Judge Maxwell 5/22/19.Clerk to reschedule appearance before 8/1/19.**
Sentencing hearing on May 28, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob W Lange in court with attorney John Joseph Grau.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grau informs the court that the defendant voluntarily discharged from Drug Treatment Court. The Court will enter the judgment of conviction and set for sentencing at the end of May.  Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given. Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on February 18, 2019 at 10:30 am.
Request for a status conference. Filed by Atty Grau

02:30 PM Defendant Jacob W Lange in court with attorney John Joseph Grau.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Grau advises that the defendant is voluntarily moving to be discharged.  State has no objection and is in agreement with the motion for discharge. Defendant presents statements.  Court orders defendant be formally discharged from DTC. Matter to be set for out of custody sentencing by Judge Maxwell's staff.
Defendant discharged from Drug Treatment Court.

03:03 PM Defendant Jacob W Lange in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the defendant.  Defendant presents statements.  Out of custody discharge hearing has been rescheduled for 01/16/2019.

02:20 PM Defendant Jacob W Lange in court, in custody, with attorney John Joseph Grau.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for hearing on State's motion for discharge.  Atty. Grau presents statements and is requesting an adjournment and requests the discharge hearing be an out of custody hearing.  State is in agreement with the request to adjourn but objects to an out of custody hearing and presents statements.  Atty. Grau responds.  Defendant presents statements.  Atty. Will presents additional statements.  Defendant presents additional statements.  Based on the information provided as well as the fact that the discharge hearing will be pushed to the new year the Court orders that the defendant may be released from custody on 12/21/2018 for an out of custody discharge hearing which is scheduled for 01/02/2019.

03:11 PM Defendant Jacob W Lange in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motions for discharge.  Court orders defendant be held until further order of this Court. Discharge hearing scheduled for December 5, 2018.  Defendant remanded into custody.  Court took a brief recess.  Case recalled at 3:22 pm; all appearances remain the same.  Court advises the defendant that it's previous order will stand.

Court denies the State's motion for discharge.  Court orders the defendant to remain in custody until further order of the Court.
